comments:
A user is able to create a linked folder with the same name as an existing 
linked file in the same project but with a different case (ex: test1 and 
Test1). This causes an exception to occur after the following steps:
a. Drag and drop the linked file in another project
b. Drag and drop the linked file back in the same project
c. You get an exception that a resource with the same name exists but with 
another case.
The user should not have been allowed to create it in the first place.

Here is the session data:
eclipse.buildId=I200406111814
java.version=1.4.2_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US

Here is the stack trace:

Note that the error is limited to a problem and a display message in the 
Navigator but causes an exception if the drag and drop is done through the 
package explorer.

Moving to JDT as there is an exception in the package explorer and not in the 
navigator.. .

Interestingly, core resources allows creating such a constallation in the 
first place but does reject the move (the exception is thrown by core 
resources). I agree that the error dialog is a little bit harsh. 

Not critical for 3.0 due to:

- not a common scenario folder test1 and file Test1. Files typically do have
  an extension
- no harm is caused. The file is left at its place and an error dialog shows
  up and a log message is generated.

Usually files have an extension but with a linked resource, a user could give 
a file description instead of a file name and could possibly use the same 
description with a different case for a folder name: image and Image.
Still there in 3.2. It seems to me that core.resources is inconsistent here. Either it should allow linked resources with a different caseing or not. So I guess the move should work here.

Definitely a bug in the link creation code.  It correctly prevents creating the duplicate if you create the link first, and then create a normal folder with different case.  It doesn't prevent you from doing it in the other order.
Fix released and regression test added to LinkedResourceTest.

traces.message: A resource  exists with a different case: /SWTTest/test1.
